competitors.name: Microsoft Teams
competitors.notes: Most notable competitor with 32.29% market share, comprehensive collaboration suite integrated with Office 365, bundled productivity solution for remote and hybrid organizations

competitors.name: Google Meet
competitors.notes: Significant competitor integrated with Google Workspace, 5.52% market share, offers 1-hour meetings for free users (vs Zoom's 40 minutes), leverages Google's cloud computing expertise

competitors.name: Cisco Webex
competitors.notes: Robust video conferencing solution with 7.61% market share, provides feature-rich collaboration tools including video meetings, webinars, and team messaging

competitors.name: GoToMeeting
competitors.notes: Closest alternative to Zoom for remote team collaborations with 8.81% market share, competitive advantage in unlimited cloud storage

competitors.name: RingCentral
competitors.notes: Cloud-based VoIP solution with 5.31% market share, features video and audio conferencing, desktop phone rentals, collaboration tools, and business application integrations

competitors.name: Slack
competitors.notes: Good alternative for smaller and more casual meetings, Slack huddles offer video chat capabilities with multi-user screen sharing and chat threads

competitors.name: Jitsi Meet
competitors.notes: Open-source video conferencing platform emphasizing simplicity and security, allows users to create and join meetings directly from web browser without accounts or downloads

competitors.name: Dialpad
competitors.notes: Cloud communications UCaaS platform providing integrated voice, video, and messaging capabilities from unified interface

context: In 2024, Zoom remained the dominant player in video conferencing with approximately 55.91% market share. However, competitors had leveled the playing field by improving their products and making them part of bundled workplace productivity tool suites designed for dispersed teams. Microsoft Teams emerged as the strongest competitor with 32.29% market share, while GoToMeeting held 8.81%, Webex 7.61%, Google Meet 5.52%, and RingCentral 5.31%. The industry underwent drastic changes with platforms increasingly incorporating workspace productivity features and AI capabilities. While Zoom previously outperformed competitors on call quality and ease of use, competitors closed this gap through product improvements and integration strategies.
